item.title: Tarique reaches Rajshahi to launch fourth phase of BNP campaign
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman reached Rajshahi on Thursday to begin the fourth phase of his election campaign, launching a three-day tour in the northern region aimed at mobilising voters in favour of BNP and its alliance candidates. Tarique reached Rajshahi by air at 12:24 pm, BNP Media Cell member

item.title: EC orders printing presses not to print election posters
item.description: The Election Commission has directed printing presses across the country not to print any posters for the 13th parliamentary election. The directive was sent to returning officers on Wednesday by Election Commission Deputy Secretary Monir Hossain. It said candidates have already begun electioneer

item.title: Parties must show responsibility, restraint: interim govt
item.description: The interim government has expressed deep concern over the recent violence in Sherpur that resulted in the death of a Jamaat-e-Islami activist. Any loss of life linked to violence is unacceptable and deeply regrettable, the Chief Advisor’s Office said in a statement on Thursday. With the na

item.title: India’s textile exporters pin hopes on EU deal after US tariff blow
item.description: India’s textile and apparel exporters, hit by 50 per cent US tariffs imposed late in August, are banking on this week's trade agreement with the European Union to offset part of the damage, while urging New Delhi to secure a quick deal with Washington. Under the pact, which will be implement

item.title: No case yet over killing of Sherpur Jamaat leader
item.description: No case has yet been filed over the death of Rezaual Karim, the Sreebordi Upazila secretary for Jamaat-e-Islami, who was killed following a clash between rival political groups during an election programme in Sherpur. The situation remains tense in the Jhenaigati and Sreebordi Upazilas of the Sher

item.title: BNP calls Sherpur killing ‘unwarranted,’ demands quick probe
item.description: BNP Election Steering Committee spokesperson Mahdi Amin on Thursday described the clash between BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami in Sherpur, which left one person dead, as “unwarranted” and called for a swift and impartial investigation. “Why did one party occupy all the chairs before the

item.title: Commonwealth, EU to deploy large observer teams for Bangladesh election
item.description: The Commonwealth and the European Union are set to deploy large election observation missions for Bangladesh’s general election and the referendum on the July reform charter, both scheduled for February 12. Lamiya Morshed, Senior Secretary and SDGs Affairs Principal Coordinator, who is suppo

item.title: 128 Bangladeshi fishermen return home from India
item.description: Bangladesh on Thursday brought back 128 Bangladeshi fishermen who had been detained in India, while simultaneously repatriating 23 Indian fishermen held in Bangladesh, under a mutual repatriation arrangement between the two neighbouring countries. The Bangladesh Coast Guard received the 128 fisher

item.title: Tarique launches northern campaign
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman has begun his election campaign in northern Bangladesh with a visit to the shrine of the revered Sufi saint Shah Makhdum (R.) in Rajshahi. He arrived at the shrine in the city’s Dargah Para around 1:15 pm on Thursday, where he paid his respects and later signed th

item.title: NBR extends income tax return filing deadline to Feb 28 for election
item.description: Ahead of the parliamentary election, the National Board of Revenue (NBR) has extended the deadline for individual taxpayers to submit their income tax returns by another month. As a result, income tax returns for the 2025–26 tax year can now be filed until Feb 28, bdnews24.com reports.

item.title: UK's Starmer signals China reset in talks with Xi, eyes economic wins
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer told Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday that he wanted to build a "sophisticated relationship" with Beijing to bolster security and the economy, signalling a reset after years of strained ties. On the key day of his four-day visit to China, the first by a

item.title: Gold nears $5,600 as safe-haven rush intensifies; silver blazes past $120
item.description: Gold advanced to a new record high near the $5,600-an-ounce level on Thursday, as investors sought refuge from escalating geopolitical tensions and weakening economic signals in the United States. Silver also benefited from the flight to safety, leaping above the $120 level. Get the latest news f
